column4: http://askubuntu.com/questions/130998/add-eclipse-to-unity-dock-in-ubuntu-12-04
Anyone able to help with that ^ ?
whats type of file is /home/username/eclipse/eclipse ?
it's the eclipse executable
executable (application/x-executable)
why run it with "/bin/sh", why not specify it directly
I get the same error when I run it directly
what version of eclipse?
ponpon, latest
* popey latest
i installed 3.7.2-1 from the ubuntu repo and it comes with a desktop file which works fine..
the .desktop file in the latest version (not repo) is the same as the .desktop from the repo and doesn't work fine for me
the one you posted isn't the same as the one from the repo
I switched to using the one from the repo about 20 minutes ago
http://paste.ubuntu.com/1011244/
and for that it doesn't run the eclipse executable, it runs /usr/bin/eclipse which is a shell script
actually you're right. I cannot use the one from the repo as I didn't get eclipse from the repo due to it being too old

the repo .desktop assumes eclipse is installed via the package manager. The common way of installing the latest version of eclipse is to just run the exec from the home/username folder. That is what my .desktop is trying to do
sure, I was thinking you could base your .desktop off the one I pastebinned
I would have to create a shell script in /bin for that to work
nah, anywhere in path like ~/bin would be fine
